result.execSummary:
The defendant Joevon D Wilder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Dangerous Weapon-Person < 18, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.60(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 16 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Court WAIVED the court costs, fees and surcharges based upon defendant's inability to pay

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joevon D Wilder

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund packet, Check issued August 9, 2018,
Judge alerted of DNA law date (1-1-14) but still wants to proceed without charging the DNA surcharges (offense date 03-16-15).
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form; filed.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Joevon D Wilder in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Anthony Jackson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Note:  **Note:  This offense occurred prior to the Wisconsin DNA law came into effect.

Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing by the State, Defense, and defendant.   

AS TO COUNT 1:    Court ordered defendant to serve 16 days in the House of Correction, with 16 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
Court WAIVED the court costs, fees, and surcharges based upon defendant's inability to pay.

Defendant Joevon D Wilder in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Anthony Jackson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Justice Point Pretrial Services  Report; Received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Joevon D Wilder in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Thaddeus P McGuire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

CD 1:51 PM

Parties are working on a resolution.
Statements made.
Court converted the 07-30-2018 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date to a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Received and Filed, Pretrial Services Supervision Report.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court.  Thaddeus P McGuire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defendant's appearance waived for today's proceeding. For reasons stated on the record, Bail motion by defense to remove defendant from felony GPS monitoring argued and GRANTED by the Court. Court ordered ALL previous conditions of bail to remain the same. Case remains calendared for Final pretrial on June 25, 2018 at 1:30 p.m., Branch 45.
-To Modify Bail; Received, filed and forwarded to the Judge for review. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Joevon D Wilder in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Thaddeus P McGuire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel has received discovery and offer. Defense counsel requests jury trial date.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial, Branch 45.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 25, 2018 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 30, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report; Received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

18RM054061  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
5/15/18
Motion to Modify Bail, received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.   Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joevon D Wilder in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Joevon D Wilder in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  ec  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 24, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael J Steinle in court.  Michael Damon Phillips appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL FORFEITED.

Defendant Joevon D Wilder in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting a trial date.  Jury Trial scheduled for April 5, 2017 at 09:00 am.  Final Pre-trial scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joevon D Wilder in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received discovery and offer.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 3, 2017 at 08:30 am.
